CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 10, 1957, pg. 17, reads: "Slums Growing in Homewood? - 'Winos' Hangout - Despite frequent complaints to police by residents and nearby businessmen, drunks still frequent this porch at 7612 Frankstown Ave., as an oasis for their drinking. William S. Howell, president of the Homewood Community Association, exhibits one of the abandoned empty wine and whiskey bottles."
TitMainTitle: William S. Howell wearing plaid shirt and light colored pants, placing bottle into basket, on lawn in front brick porch, 7612 Frankstown Avenue, Homewood
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Refuse and refuse disposal--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Baskets--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Porches--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Brick walls--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Lawns--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Fences--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Frankstown Avenue (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Howell, William.
